basics.name: Sean Owen Clancy, Ph.D.
basics.label: Director of Materials Science, Leader, Scientist, Problem Solver, Technology Developer
basics.summary: I’m passionate about science, technology, community, and family. Working hard isn’t enough, you also have to be flexible, innovative, and ethical. That’s what will makes me a valuable member of organizations, as well as being a good friend. I have strong technical skills and hands-on experience in creating or modifying existing products and processes using analytical, synthetic organic, and polymer chemistry, as well as materials science and engineering. I’ve helped develop and qualify existing and new materials and manufacturing processes, as well as figured things out when issues arose and how to get a manufacturing line up and running again. Besides science and technology, I have experience in project management, technical writing, communications, and marketing. Outside of chemistry and the sciences, I enjoy the culinary arts, drawing, photography, reading, gaming, web design, and working with computers.

interests.name: Characterization Methods for the Performance and Properties of Materials

education.institution: Naval Air Warfare Center Weapons Development, China Lake, CA
University of Southern California, Los Angeles, CA
University of North Florida, Jacksonville, FL

work.summary: Subject matter expert (SME) for coatings and electronics manufacturing materials and processes
highlights: Director of Materials Science, 2020-Present
Director of Coating Technology, 2019-2020
Chemical Engineer, 2018-2019
Chemist and Project Manager, 2014-2016

work.summary: Serve as an advisor to faculty, students, and the Materials CharacterizationLab (MCL) in the Department of Materials Science and Engineering (MSE).
highlights: Adjunct Professor, 2018-Present
Associate Director & Program Manager, Materials Characterization Laboratory, 2017-2018

work.summary: Served clients in the defense, electronics conformal coating, coatingprecursor supplier, and the oil and gas pipeline inspection services markets.
highlights: Provided consulting services in the STEAM fields (science, technology,engineering, arts, and mathematics) with practical solutions to development,manufacturing, and process issues, as well as advice, instrumental analysis,teaching materials, and training services.

work.summary: Managed high-value projects in electronics manufacturing for the US Navy, delivered training courses, provided laboratory services, and wrote technical publications.
highlights: Managed high-value projects in electronics manufacturing for the US Navy and managed laboratory services for commercial customers, which included building and managing diverse, multidisciplinary teams, coordinating and planning analyses, and developing and selecting test methods in an ISO 9001 Quality System registered facility, and according to ASTM, IPC, JEDEC, MIL,and other standards.
Delivered over 250 project reports with greater than $550k in commercial sales. Assisted on more than 300 other projects with planning, execution, and peer review for an additional $600k in sales.

Wrote eleven articles for EMPFasis, a publication of the Electronics Manufacturing Productivity Facility (EMPF), of which two were republished in Printed Circuit Design & Fab/Circuits Assembly: The Journal of Surface Mountand Electronics Assembly.

Wrote “Failure analysis techniques for electronics” instructional and technicalmarketing book with a case studies companion presentation for commercialservices and professional skills training courses. * Updated curriculum and delivered instruction for professional skills trainingcourses: Failure Analysis and Reliability Testing in Electronics and ElectronicsManufacturing Boot Camps.

work.summary: Developed small molecule and polymer coatings for carbon nanotubes (CNTs) and other electrodes on integrated circuits (ICs) for electrochemical sensors.
highlights: Evaluated ion-sensitive field effect transistor (ISFET) devices as sensors and determined the root cause of a 50% failure rate for ISFETs by examining the CAD data and found errors in the silicon design, leading to a Corrective and Preventative Action (CAPA) for the following Metal Oxide Semiconductor Implementation Service (MOSIS) run.

Assisted materials engineers with thermal-chemical vapor deposition (TCVD) and plasma enhanced-CVD (PE-CVD) growth of CNTs, initiated-CVD (iCVD) growth of polymer films, as well as supercritical carbon dioxide (scCO2) fluid infusion processes.

work.company: Naval Air Warfare Center Weapons Division (NAWCWD)
work.summary: Developed conjugated polymers and deposition processes for charge storage applications.
highlights: Published a project in the peer-reviewed Journal of the Electrochemical Society 2007, 154 (4), G95-G98.

work.summary: Developed conjugated polymers, ligands, and lanthanide complexes for energy transfer studies and optical applications.
highlights: Published multiple projects in the MRS, PMSE, and SPIE proceedings.
Presented project results at MRS and SPIE conferences.

work.summary: Developed conjugated polymers, ligands, and lanthanide complexes for energy transfer studies and optical applications.
highlights: Moved with graduate research advisor from TAMU to USC.

work.summary: Developed many small molecule compounds and peptide nucleic acid (PNA) sequences in collaboration with molecular biology and neuroscience research groups.
highlights: Contributed to efforts that led to multiple publications for the primary investigators and their groups.
Compounds served as diagnostic tools and therapeutic candidates for muscular and neurodegenerative diseases.

work.summary: Assisted pharmacists in the filling of prescriptions, along with instructing, operating, and providing support for a UNIX-based prescription filling system.

publications.name: Failure analysis techniques for electronics
publications.author: Sean O. Clancy
publications.summary:
Failure Analysis Techniques for Electronics provides an overview of the characterization methods available at ACI Technologies, Inc. for determining the causes of failure in electronics devices. 
 
This publication will assist the reader in making informed decisions when troubleshooting a manufacturing problem and/or collaborating with an analytical laboratory. The proper selection of the appropriate test methods will help to identify the process conditions that lead to less than desirable issues and in turn assist in delivering a quality product.
